intro: Tashiroea okinawensis, commonly known as the Okinawa tashiroea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tashiroea okinawensis is considered a vulnerable species.
